::Battera:;

"That's why this is so important.  If this works out, they won't 
break this one." she said.  She stopped where she stood. "Look, as 
for me, I care about nothing for myself. What I do care about is that 
this war ends.  With no more casualties.  Both sides have suffered 
losses, both sides have fought and lost.  This war makes little sence 
to anyone and the only real reason it keeps on going it because 
neither side can trust the other." She placed one hand on her hip.
"Both sides need to sit down and talk about a truce to all this.  
That's why I'm even here in the first place.  I'm here to try to talk 
your commander into at least thinking about meeting with us, and the 
other Maximal and Predacon groups. To try to talk out our 
differences.  Try to gain an understanding of one another and put an 
end to this war." she looked down. "Or all will end and no one will 
live to regret not trying." She turned and started walking back to 
her quarters.



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> ::Rex::
> 
> Rex raises an eyebrow at Battera's outburst. He was not used to 
bots behaving 
> that way, especially not while they were in a fully armed base with 
a fully 
> armed bot standing in front of them. Rex starts walking after 
Battera.
> 
> "Its not hate," he says, "Its that the Predacons break every treaty 
we ever 
> make with them."
> 
> He growls silently as he remembers the comrads lost to Predacon 
attacks and 
> backstabings, the sole cause of his hatred of Predacons.
